[/align]

[color=#FFFFE0][b]NCA Surface on Hack Forums[/b][/color]
It is no surprise that the government lurk this site for unethical and illegal practices. On Dec. 12, the National Crime Agency (NCA) were the very first to surface on Hack Forums and actually post. Not many took heed of the NCA until [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] proceeded to then post confirmation of the authoritative figures behind the account. The message/unintentional warning came shortly after law enforcement targeted over 100 people who took part in committing DDoS attacks. Congratulations on achieving L33t, NCA. [i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5491746]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=#FFFFE0][b]On a Positive Note... Christmas is Almost Here![/b][/color]
Christmas being just around the corner, the Writers (both the Wiki and News Teams) wish you a very merry Christmas. The annual festival is the time to spread good cheer, spend time with your family and loved ones, receiving and giving. [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] has also been kind enough to leave us with a cheer Christmas message which reads "Spend time with family and stop reading HF News".

[b][color=white][u]Announcement Threads[/u][/color][/b]
[list]

No announcement threads this week.[/list]

[b][color=white][u]Informational Threads[/u][/color][/b]
[list]

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5497132][b][christmas]All the christmas skins released![/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2859279][b][color=#FFFFFF]Brusk[/color][/b][/url]
Brusk showcases some of the new Christmas-themed hero skins Blizzard has added to Overwatch. [/list]

[b][color=white][u]Entertaining Threads[/u][/color][/b]
[list]

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5499528][b]Christmas Gifts for a Girlfriend[/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1748669][b][color=#FFFFFF]Wirt[/color][/b][/url]
Possibly one of the toughest people to buy for, Wirt asks for help when choosing what to get his girlfriend for Christmas, as the community chimes in with their suggestions. Tis the season! 

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5496127][b][CHRISTMAS TREE] Post the Christmas tree you have at home[/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3282602][b][color=#FFFFFF]fannas1[/color][/b][/url]
Share the Christmas spirit and post a photo of your Christmas tree![/list]

[b][color=white][u]Member Feedback Threads[/u][/color][/b]
[list]

No members feedback threads this week.[/list]

[b][color=white][u]Contests and Giveaways[/u][/color][/b]
[list]

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5493821][b][The Society] $1500+ Christmas Giveaway [ALL MEMBERS][/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3132621][b][color=#FFFFFF]Σnron[/color][/b][/url]
To celebrate The Holidays, The Society is generously holding a whopping $1500+ giveaway! The spirit of giving is very much alive.  

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5497983][b]{Notorious} Holiday Giveaway[/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1125893][b][color=#FFFFFF]Gt403cyl[/color][/b][/url]
The abundance of Christmas giveaways have only just begun! Notorious is holding a holiday giveaway with over 5 prizes up for grabs.[/list]

[b][color=white][u]Miscellaneous[/u][/color][/b]
[list]

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5499779][b]YOU MAY BE SCAMMED[/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url]
As a stern warning to all members who partake in currency exchanging on Hack Forums, [b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient[/color][/b] has again reinforced and made it clear that there are malicious people out there with the sole intent to steal from the community. As always, tread with caution as all deals on Hack Forums are at your own risk.[/list]

[align=center][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v3/Interview/321a.gif[/img][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v3/Interview/322b.png[/img][/align]

[align=center][color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview [/font][/size][/color][color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2208210]Nuworld[/url][/font][/size][spoiler=][align=left]

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1327245][color=red][b]zSerity:[/b][/color][/url] Hello and welcome to the special Christmas edition #322 of the Hack Forums news! Before we start, are there any shout outs you'd like to make or is there anything you'd like to say?
[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2208210][color=white][b]Nuworld:[/b][/color][/url] I would like to give a shout out to Knautschtabak aka Zey. Thanks for all the help and teaching prifide on WHF.

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1327245][color=red][b]zSerity:[/b][/color][/url] Tis the season to be jolly. What are your plans for the holidays?
[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2208210][color=white][b]Nuworld:[/b][/color][/url] Thank you for asking, many may not know of me and who I am. Many see my avatar as Chinese though I'm American but my family is Chinese. For the holidays we will do a normal Christmas as most do here in the states, we have the tree and give gifts.

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1327245][color=red][b]zSerity:[/b][/color][/url] That's awesome. So did you grow up most of your life in American or China?
[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2208210][color=white][b]Nuworld:[/b][/color][/url] I was born in riverside California in 1963. In 1965 my family moved to Scottsdale Arizona where I was raised and spent my years growing up. I found my way to china after meeting my wife. She was there as a student at college.

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1327245][color=red][b]zSerity:[/b][/color][/url] Will you be celebrating both the Chinese and American New Years?
[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2208210][color=white][b]Nuworld:[/b][/url] Yes, in my family we celebrate new years at different times as most know in America new years is on the first of January, in china it's different each year.

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1327245][color=red][b]zSerity[/b][/color][/url] Chinese New Years parties look way more fun than traditional American ones. Which do you prefer?
[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2208210[color=white][b]Nuworld:[/b][/color][/url] China new years is the way to go by far, there is no comparison to America and Chinese new years, In the states it's only one night/day. In china it's a full week of fireworks and parties, it's a 24/7 party. 

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1327245][color=red][b]zSerity:[/b][/color][/url] And I bet the food is off the charts?
[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2208210][color=white][b]Nuworld:[/b][/url] Yes, the food is great, my wife is from Chongqing, China. The food there is very spicy and hot! Though I eat Chinese food everyday, I do miss my steak and potatoes at times.

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1327245][color=red][b]zSerity:[/b][/color][/url] Ah yeah you mentioned that to me before. You said it was like heaven there, are you planning on moving there in the future permanently?
[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2208210][color=white][b]Nuworld:[/b][/color][/url] Yes we own a house in Chongqing and we visit each year. When we retire we will be moving to china for good. But we will also keep the house we own here in Ohio as a backup home.

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1327245][color=red][b]zSerity:[/b][/color][/url] Do you want to tell the community what you do for a living? I think it's pretty incredible.
[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2208210][color=white][b]Nuworld:[/b][/color][/url] I'm a Retired Lt. Colonel pilot in the U.S. Air force. Though I'm still in the reserves and could be called back to active duty anytime. I fought in the Gulf war both in desert storm and Iraqi Freedom. I was shot down twice and lived to make this post. I am only a small hand full of people that own there own F-16 plane in the U.S.

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1327245][color=red][b]zSerity:[/b][/color][/url] That's crazy! I bet there were plenty of times when you couldn't be home for Christmas so I'm sure you cherish the ones when you are. Before we wrap up the interview, what are you hoping Santa brings you this year? Are you planning on treating yourself to anything?
[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2208210[color=white][b]Nuworld:[/b][/color][/url] This is a very good question you ask. I ask this question every year to myself. I guess the best answer to this question is that I'm still alive after the war and all the death that I witnessed? I'm just happy I'm still here with my family, that is all I need. Happy holidays everyone. 

[/align][/spoiler][/align]

The Batmobile Lost a Wheel
And Joker got away

[color=transparent]   [/color]

[align=center][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v3/ScienceNews/ryand8_SN.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Historic Texts Recovered From ISIS[/color][/b]
Constructed over 1,500 years ago, the "Monastery of Martyr Mar Benham and his sister Sarah" held religious texts, illustrations and carved inscriptions dating back several hundred years. Christian in nature, the text are said to depict "lengthy colophons" of historical and social religious events. ISIS occupied the Christian monastery beginning June 2014 until just recently, November 2016, when it was recaptured by an Iraqi Christian unit combatting the efforts of ISIS in the nation. Due to the restless state of the nation, it is not sure whether the texts will be kept in Iraq or moved to Europe for safe keeping; however, said to contain the genealogy of Jesus Christ and other never before released religious works, much research on the texts is still to be done.[i][size=x-small][url=http://www.livescience.com/57240-historic-texts-hidden-isis-occupied-monastery.html] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Cellular Reprogramming Slows Aging[/color][/b]
The fountain of youth may very well be brewing somewhere in a graduated cylinder. According to a new study, Scientists have found that "induction of partial cellular reprogramming improved muscle regeneration in aged mice" with little to no noticeable side effects. When comparing two different mice suffering from the same premature aging defect, treatment was only given to one of the mice. The study found that the mouse receiving the treatment induced expressions of "Yamanaka" factors in all cells using their "partial reprogramming approach". Not only did the function of the kidneys, stomach, liver and skins cells improve, but the heart (the cardiovascular system often fails to be effected by similar treatment) also showed improvements in structure and function.[i][size=x-small][url=https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/12/161215143541.htm] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Run Hack Forums Run[/color][/b]
Have you ever thought about taking up running as a hobby? You may want to start. According to a study done by the University of Arizona, MRI scans showed that running may affect the structure and function of the brain in a positive manner. A study was done comparing a group of male cross country runners to young adult males (18-25 years old) who hadn't engaged in any kind of organized athletic activity for at least a year. The scans measured the participants through multiple states of movement and coordination tests to find that those who consistently exercised experienced stronger neural activity, even while at rest. The areas affected have also been linked to neural diseases such as Alzheimer's meaning consistent exercising could provide resilience against the effects of again on your brain. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/12/161214151637.htm] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[align=center][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v3/Arixs.png[/img][/align]

[color=#FFFFFF][b]China seizes US Naval Vessel in South China Sea[/b][/color]
A US Navy Underwater drone collecting unclassified data in international waters has been commandeered by China on December 16th The Navy drone was collecting two gliders 50 miles out from Subic Bay when the Chinese vessel apprehended and seized the drone. The Chinese acknowledged radio messages to return the drone, but did not hail. [size=x-small][color=#FFFFFF] [i][url=http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/asia/china-seize-us-navy-underwater-vehicle-south-china-sea-one-china-taiwan-a7480016.html]>Source[/url][/size][/color][/i]

[b][color=#FFFFFF]Car Bomb Attack in Turkey[/b][/color]
On the morning of December 17th the city of Kayseri, Turkey, was the site of a recent car bomb attack. The attack was targeted towards the gate of the Erciyes University, blowing up a transport bus. The explosion took the lives of 13 Turkish soldiers and injured some 56 more people. Currently, 7 suspects are being held for the bombing, and the police are searching for at least 5 more. No one claimed responsibility for this attack, but it is thought to have been carried out by Kurdistan Workers Party, or the PKK for short. [size=x-small][color=#FFFFFF][i] [url=http://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/turkish-news-agency-reports-car-bomb-attack-44252347]>Source[/url][/size][/i][/color]

[b][color=#FFFFFF]Aleppo Evacuation Busses Burned by Rebels[/color][/b]
Following the ongoing conflict in Syria and the evacuation of Aleppo, rebels have intercepted buses evacuating the sick and injured and then proceeded to torch them, though some buses did succeed in evacuating successfully. The evacuation of Aleppo has been going on for about a week and has already been halted by shootings, bombings, and sabotage of government vehicles.[size=x-small][color=#FFFFFF][i] [url=http://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-38358177]>Source[/url][/size][/i][/color]

[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/5EHiJAb.png[/img][/align]

[align=left]
[color=white][url=http://transition.fcc.gov/Daily_Releases/Daily_Business/2016/db1215/DOC-342617A1.pdf][b]FCC Chairman Tom Wheeler to Step Down[/b][/url][/color]
The savior of net neutrality is stepping down. Tom Wheeler, the chairman of the Federal Communications Commission, announced Thursday that he will resign from the agency Jan. 20, the day Donald Trump’s new administration begins. His departure means the FCC will start the Trump administration with a 2-1 Republican majority. The Obama appointee who has led the agency for three years, was the driving force behind a number of sweeping regulations that aimed to inject competition into the telecommunications sector. The move makes it easier for Republicans to try to repeal net neutrality, as well as other controversial actions taken by the agency’s Democratic majority under President Obama.

[color=white][url=https://news.xbox.com/2016/12/14/dolby-atmos-xbox-one-windows-10/][b]Microsoft to Support Dolby Atmos on Xbox One and Windows 10[/b][/url][/color]
Microsoft announced that Windows 10 PCs and the Xbox One console are both set to get native support for Dolby Atmos, the new surround sound technology from Dolby Laboratories. The object-based sound format has so far been limited to a select few PC games. The Xbox One will become the first console to feature Dolby Atmos sound, thanks to an update available on Xbox One Preview, its exclusive beta program. The full update for all users will be coming to consoles, Windows 10 PCs and tablets sometime in 2017. The Xbox One and Windows 10 integration will work with any headphones as well as compatible speaker systems or soundbars, Microsoft revealed.

[color=white][url=https://torrentfreak.com/kickasstorrents-brought-back-to-life-by-original-staffers-161216/][b]KickassTorrents Brought Back From the Dead[/b][/url][/color]
After a long wait, a near perfect clone of the original Kickass Torrents (KAT) portal surfaced online Friday. Resurrected by a group of the original staff, who first brought the community part of the site back at katcr.co, the infamous torrent site is now located at katcr.co/new. KickassTorrents was shut down after its alleged founder, Artem Vaulin was arrested in Poland and all official domain names were seized by the US Justice Department. Even with the main website dead, a lot of clones of the popular torrent website cropped up on the web, but were nothing more than pale shadows of the original KickassTorrents.
[/align]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v3/Cimex.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]1-Billion Yahoo Database Supposedly Sold for $300,000 on Dark Web[/color][/b]
It is no secret now to how public the details about the 2013 Yahoo data breach are. The newest update on this attack proceeds, with efforts believing that two prominent spammers and a third person was involved with buying the database. The database contains personal information such as: Full Names, Passwords (MD5 Encrypted), Date of Births, Phone Numbers and more. [i][size=x-small][url=http://thehackernews.com/2016/12/yahoo-hacking.html] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]EA: Battlefield 1 Servers Down After DDoS Attack by Phantom Squad[/color][/b]
It is getting to that time of year where people love DDoSing companies for internet fame. The latest attack which has been found to be condoned by Phantom Squad, affected users all around the world. Phantom Squad took credit for this attack on their Twitter, furthermore claiming that the attack was some sort of test. With that being said, it is still unclear whether it was Phantom Squad and their claims to DDoSing the Battlefield 1 servers or a technical issue that affected the downtime. EA are still yet to comment on these claims, but claims by Phantom Squad may be probable. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.hackread.com/you-are-not-alone-ea-servers-are-down//] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]305,000 PayAsUGym Credentials Stolen in Data Breach[/color][/b]
PayAsUGym recently confirmed that they had been the latest victims to a cyber-attack which affected 305,000 customers. The company themselves said they do not keep customer’s financial information, although the hackers that seem to have carried out the attack claim against this. A strong statement from the company states that the financial credentials were not stolen, as the website uses a tokenized system, therefore no credentials are stored directly on their servers. A Twitter user that goes by the username “@real_1x0123” attempted to contact the company multiple times but had no response in the process. According to 1x0123, the hack was obtained and carried out via a zero-day attack. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.scmagazine.com/payasugym-hacked-305000-sets-of-customer-credentials-stolen/article/579963//] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[align=center][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v3/GamingNews.png[/img][/align]
[b][color=white]Super Mario Run Downloaded 10 Times More Than Pokemon Go On First Day! [/color][/b]
The highly anticipated mobile game, Super Mario Run, was released this week and it's numerous are impressive to say the least.  App Annie has published data, which states that Super Mario Run was downloaded over 10 million times worldwide on December 15. That's 10 times the amount Pokemon Go managed in its first day! It's an impressive figure for Mario and Nintendo's mobile game debut, though it also isn't an especially fair comparison. Super Mario Run is available in 150 countries, whereas Pokemon Go launched in only three countries, albeit on iOS and Android. However, the game was downloaded by an estimated 3.5 million users in just the US alone, so it is fair to say that Pokemon Go's number were left in the dust. What do you think about Super Mario Run? Let us know! [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/super-mario-run-downloaded-10-times-as-much-as-pok/1100-6446335/] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]FIFA 17 Throws Freebies out For "FUTmas" [/color][/b]
The latest edition of FIFA, is now throwing out freebies within the Ultimate Team to get into the Christmas spirit. The festive spirited for FIFA started December 16, and ends on January 3. In order to obtain one of these gifts all you have to do is log into FIFA 17 Ultimate Team daily and you will be handed a pack, coins or something completely different. The festive spirit being brought to you by FIFA, also unlocks a bunch of new challenges such as the Mystery Packs. Grab an extra freebie by logging into the FIFA Ultimate Team Web Application. Be sure to let us know what you receive! [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/fifa-17-giving-away-free-items-in-12-days-of-futma/1100-6446376/] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[align=center][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v3/Trends/reBELLYus.png[/img]
[/align]

[b][url=http://www.smh.com.au/world/thousands-evacuated-from-aleppo-after-deal-over-besieged-villages-20161219-gtek04.html][color=#FFFFFF]Aleppo Evacuations[/color][/url]
[/b]An array of areas within Syria have been taken over by both ISIL and insurgent groups. This has been the case over the last year or so and is continuing to be a large issue for those who are inhabitants of Syria. In Aleppo, mass chaos has been taking place in which adults, children, and even infants are losing their lives due to a slew of bombings and firefights that are taking place in the region. "Thousands of people were evacuated from the last rebel-held enclave of Aleppo on Monday in return for insurgents allowing people to leave two besieged pro-government villages in nearby Idlib province." While the United Nations is concerned about the people of Aleppo, the U.N. does not want insurgents to make their way out of the region. Insurgents are still occupying Aleppo with scores vowing to die fighting for what they deemed to be their land.

[b][url=http://www.eonline.com/news/816883/everything-we-know-about-rob-kardashian-and-blac-chyna-s-social-media-meltdown][color=#FFFFFF]Blac Chyna Versus Rob Kardashian[/color][/url]
[/b]“Rob Kardashian and Blac Chyna seemed to be living in baby bliss ever since Dream Kardashian was born, but this weekend it became clear that not everything was rainbows and roses.” On Saturday, Chyna’s account on the popular social media platform known as Instagram was supposedly taken over by an unknown hacker. While the hacker was in control, he/she managed to post a plethora of screenshots that went on to show Chyna had other plans for being with Rob. According to the images posted on her Instagram account, Chyna wanted to own a $10M home without Rob. Even more, she wanted to get married and trademark the last name Kardashian in hopes of cashing in on the family business that is ballooning in size as time continues to move forward. Fast forward to today and Rob has made a public apology in which he pleads with Chyna to return home. Is this the beginning of the end for Rob and Chyna?

[b][url=http://www.nytimes.com/2016/12/19/world/europe/russia-ambassador-shot-ankara-turkey.html][color=#FFFFFF]Russian Ambassador Assassinated[/color][/url]
[/b]The shooting of Andrey G. Karlov, a Russian ambassador, took place earlier this morning. A shootout ensued after the assailant had murdered Mr. Karlov in cold blood. Moments after the shootout began, the 22-year old suspect was declared dead. The shooter, an off-duty police officer, had shouted prior and after the shooting.“God is great!” and “don’t forget Aleppo, don’t forget Syria!” The security team that was watching over Mr. Karlov was weak and not properly orchestrated as has been reported by Turkish officials. “President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia said on Russian television that Mr. Karlov had been “despicably killed” to sabotage ties with Turkey.” As of now. President Putin and Turkish President Erdogan are going to work in cahoots with one another to get to the bottom of the senseless killing.
